It’s dialectic and it defines the past rather than the future. In the beginning was the atomic realm with an evolving side (‘active’) and a supportive side (‘passive’). The first was mass (from which atoms evolved) and energy (light, etc.). Then came life. In this biotic realm, animals were active and plants passive. Then came people, the human realm, with themselves the active and our machines the passive principle. But this doesn’t tell us what’s ahead. This probably is because the future depends upon whether or not we can get into Space. If so, new kinds of machine will have enabled us. If not they’ll go on without us…
